block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Connecticut this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com, or by mail to Connecticut Weekly, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
Music and Dance

Bethel Swing du Jour, jazz. Tuesday at 6:30 p.m. Free. Pizzeria Lauretano, 291 Greenwood Avenue. (203) 792-1500. Fairfield ''Everything is Possible,'' cabaret performance presented by Maureen Hamill, vocalist, and Matthew Ward, pianist. June 9 at 7:30 p.m. $22; members, $17. Fairfield Theater Company, 70 Sanford Street. (203) 259-1036. Greenwich Ghulam Ali, ghazal vocalist. June 10 at 5 p.m. $45. Cole Auditorium, 101 West Putnam Avenue. (203) 322-9862. Greenwich Greenwich Music Festival: Antares Ensemble, presented by the Greenwich Music Festival. June 3 at 8 p.m. $25; seniors and students, $20. Greenwich Library, 101 West Putnam Avenue. (203) 622-7900. Hartford BrassDrumBone, jazz trio. Friday at 8:30 p.m. $10; members, $8. Real Art Ways, 56 Arbor Street. (860) 232-1006. Hartford Adam Miller Dance Project, contemporary ballet. Thursday and Friday at 7:30 p.m. $15 to $25. Wadsworth Atheneum Museum of Art, 600 Main Street. (860) 249-7748. Mystic ''Sea Music Festival,'' performances by the Northern Neck Chantey Singers, Fisher Poets and others. June 7 through June 10. Free with museum admission; evening concerts require tickets. Mystic Seaport, 75 Germanville Avenue. (860) 572-0711. New Hartford ''Jazz Under the Tent,'' performed by the Brian Torff Quartet. June 9 at 7 p.m. $15 and $20. The Licia and Mason Beekley Community Library, 10 Central Avenue. (860) 379-7235. New Haven Adam Birnbaum Trio, jazz. Friday at 8:30 and 10 p.m. $15 and $20. Firehouse 12, 45 Crown Street. (203) 785-0468. New Haven International Festival of Arts and Ideas: ''The Movie Music of Spike Lee and Terence Blanchard.'' The music of Terence Blanchard performed by Kurt Elling, Raoul Midón and Dee Dee Bridgewater; introduced by Spike Lee. June 9 at 8 p.m. Free. Angélique Kidjo, singer-songwriter, with Gokh-Bi System, Senegalese hip-hop. June 10 at 7 p.m. Free. New Haven Green, (203) 776-7331. Ridgefield Joe Bonamassa, blues and rock guitarist. Wednesday at 8 p.m. $27.50 and $40. Ridgefield Playhouse, 80 East Ridge Avenue. (203) 438-5795. Sherman Summer Music Series Kick-Off Festival, with performances by the Sherman Chamber Ensemble, food and activities. June 9, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Free. Village Green, Routes 37 and 39. (860) 355-5930.
Theater

Hartford ''Nightingale,'' written and performed by Lynn Redgrave, directed by Joseph Hardy. Through July 1. $22 to $42. Hartford Stage, 50 Church Street. (860) 527-5151. Milford ''I Hate Hamlet,'' comedy by Paul Rudnick, presented by Eastbound Theater, directed by Keith Padin. Through June 17. $15; seniors and students, $12.50. Milford Center for the Arts, 40 Railroad Avenue. (203) 878-6647. New Britain Molière's ''Tartuffe,'' directed by Antoni Sadlak. Through June 9. Donation: $15. Hole in the Wall Theater, 116 Main Street. (860) 229-3049. New Haven Chekhov's ''Uncle Vanya,'' adapted and directed by Gordon Edelstein. Through Sunday. $31.25 to $61.25. Long Wharf Theater, 222 Sargent Drive. (203) 787-4282. Stratford ''The Complete Works of William Shakespeare (Abridged),'' presented by the Hudson Shakespeare Company. June 9 at 2 p.m. Free. Stratford Library, 2203 Main Street. (203) 385-4162. Torrington The Nancy Marine Studio Theater Season: ''A Streetcar Named Desire.'' Friday through June 17. $10.50 to $15.50. Warner Theater, 68 Main Street. (860) 489-7180. Waterbury ''Buddy: The Buddy Holly Story,'' with music from Ritchie Valens and the Big Bopper. Through June 10. $27 to $45. Seven Angels Theater, Plank Road in Hamilton Park Pavilion. (203) 757-4676. West Haven ''A Street Car Named Desire,'' by Tennessee Williams, directed by Carol L. Penney. Through June 10. $12; students, $6. Dodds Auditorium, University of New Haven, (203) 932-7246. Westport ''Souvenir,'' by Stephen Temperley, directed by Vivian Matalon. Through June 16. $35 to $55. Westport Country Playhouse, 25 Powers Court. (203) 227-4177. Westport ''Lend Me a Tenor'' by Ken Ludwig. Through June 17. $12 to $16. Westport Town Hall, 110 Myrtle Avenue. (203) 226-1983.
Film

New Haven ''National Velvet,'' directed by Clarence Brown. June 10 at 2 p.m. Free. Yale Center for British Art, 1080 Chapel Street. (203) 432-2800. Stamford ''The Last King of Scotland,'' directed by Kevin Macdonald. June 9 at 2 p.m. Free. Ferguson Library Main Branch, 1 Public Library Plaza. (203) 964-1000.
Spoken Word
Stratford Claude Smith, author of ''The Stratford Devil.'' Thursday at 7 p.m. Free. Stratford Library, 2203 Main Street. (203) 385-4162.
For Children

Stamford The Zucchini Brothers, children's music trio. June 9 at 10 a.m. and noon. $5 to $15. Stamford Theater Works, 200 Strawberry Hill Avenue. (203) 359-4414. West Hartford ''Color Play: The Art and Science of Color and Light,'' explore light and holographic refraction. Ages 12 and under. Through June 17. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. The Children's Museum, 950 Trout Brook Drive. (860) 231-2824.
Museums and Galleries

Clinton ''In Full Bloom,'' an exhibition of flower-themed art. Through June 24. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Sylvan Gallery, 121 West Main Street. (860) 669-7278. Greenwich ''Abstraction: American and European Art in the Twentieth Century,'' works by Fernand Léger, George Valmier and others. Through June 18. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Abby M. Taylor Fine Art, 43 Greenwich Avenue. (203) 622-0906. Greenwich ''Zip, Bop and Whir: Toys of the 20th Century,'' exhibition exploring the evolution of toy technology. Through July 8. ''Weaving a Collection: Native American Baskets From the Bruce Museum.'' Through June 10. ''Fakes and Forgeries: The Art of Deception,'' over 50 examples of forged Western painting and sculpture. Through Sept. 9. $7; seniors and students, $6; children 5 and under, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Bruce Museum of Arts and Sciences, 1 Museum Drive. (203) 869-0376. Hartford Works by Shaun Leonardo, Fay Ku, Nadya Volicer and Jillian Conrad. Through July 1. Donation: $3; members, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Thursdays and Sundays, 2 to 10 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 2 p.m. to midnight. Real Art Ways, 56 Arbor Street. (860) 232-1006. Hartford ''Picasso to Pop: Aspects of Modern Art,'' exhibition of the museum's holdings from many 20th-century genres. Through Nov. 18. ''Hartford Youth Art Renaissance,'' works by Hartford public school students. Through June 10. $3 to $10; members and children 12 and under, free. Hours: Wednesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; first Thursdays of the month, 11 a.m. to 8 p.m. Wadsworth Atheneum Museum of Art, 600 Main Street. (860) 838-4058. Lakeville Paintings and drawings by Laura Ball, Peter Barrett and Josh Dorman. Through June 24. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Morgan Lehman Gallery, 24 Sharon Road, Route 41. (860) 435-0898. Lakeville ''Works on Paper and Assemblages,'' works by Ann Conrad, Constance Old, Eve Stockton and Jane de Jonge. Through June 24. ''Works on Paper and Assemblages,'' with Ann Conrad and others. Through June 30. Free. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m., or by appointment. The White Gallery, 343 Main Street. (860) 435-1029. Lakeville ''Arthur Getz: Fine Artist and Illustrator.'' Through June 17. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Tremaine Gallery at the Hotchkiss School, 11 Interlaken Road. (860) 435-4423. New Haven ''Interleaving,'' juried exhibition with works by 16 artists. Through June 17. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Arts + Literature Laboratory, 319 Peck Street. (203) 671-5175. New Haven ''Cultural Passages: Identity Made Visible,'' juried exhibition. Through June 22. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Creative Arts Workshop, 80 Audubon Street. (203) 562-4927. New Haven ''Much Joy in Mudville: 150 Years of Connecticut's Irish in Baseball.'' Through Sept. 14. Free. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Sundays, 3 to 5 p.m.. Ethnic Heritage Center, 270 Fitch Street. (203) 392-6126. New Haven ''Revolution: Cuba's Emerging Photographers.'' Through June 16. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, noon to 6 p.m. Exposure Gallery of Photography, 1 Whitney Avenue. (203) 494-9905. New Haven ''International Mail Art Exhibition,'' artist-designed postcards from around the world. Through June 27. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Small Space Gallery, 70 Audubon Street. (203) 772-2788. New Haven ''Paul Mellon's Legacy: A Passion for British Art,'' more than 250 works from the Mellon Collection. Through July 29. Free. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Yale Center for British Art, 1080 Chapel Street. (203) 432-2800. New Haven ''Made for Love: Selections From the Jane Katcher Collection of Americana,'' 30 works of art that focus on the ways love and friendship are expressed through gift exchange. Through Aug. 26. ''What Is a Line? Drawings From the Collection,'' works by Sol LeWitt, Trisha Brown, Agnes Martin and others. Through July 22. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 6 p.m. Yale University Art Gallery, (203) 432-0600. New London ''Ana Flores: Cuba Journal.'' Through June 16. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 4 p.m. ALVA Gallery, 54 State Street. (860) 437-8664. New London ''Gas in Glass: The Light Sculptures of Mundy Hepburn.'' Through June 24. ''Expresiones/Expressions: Caribbean and Latin American Art From the Benjamin Ortiz Collection.'' Through June 24. $3 and $4; children 6 and under, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Lyman Allyn Art Museum, 625 Williams Street. (860) 443-2545. Old Lyme ''The Freedom Business: Connecticut Landscapes Through the Eyes of Venture Smith,'' poems by Marilyn Nelson paired with paintings from the museum's collection. Through June 24. ''A Circle of Friends: The Artists of the Florence Griswold Museum.'' Through July 1. $4 to $8; under 6, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Florence Griswold Museum, 96 Lyme Street. (860) 434-5542. Ridgefield ''The Photograph as Canvas,'' works by artists who draw or paint on photographs. Through June 10. ''Tekrar,'' sound installation by David Abir. Through Aug. 12. ''W(E)AVE,'' sound and textile collaboration between Elana Herzog and Michael Schumacher. Through Aug. 12. ''Blow Ups: Spores, Pollen and Pollutants,'' works by Kysa Johnson. Through June 10. ''Castles, Dwarfs, and Happychaps,'' work by Arturo Herrera created using the Renaissance technique of pouncing. Through Sept. 2. ''Chrysanthemum Anthems,'' sculpture by Dario Robleto based on American soldiers' experience of wars. Through June 17. $7; seniors and students, $4; members, K-12 teachers and children under 18, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Aldrich Contemporary Art Museum, 258 Main Street. (203) 438-4519. Ridgefield ''Camera Works,'' a group photography exhibit. Through July 8. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Ridgefield Guild of Artists Gallery, 34 Halpin Lane. (203) 438-8863. Roxbury ''Places,'' assemblages by Elisabeth Munro Smith. Through June 11. Hours: Mondays, noon to 7 p.m.; Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 7 p.m.; Thursdays and Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Minor Memorial Library, 23 South Street. (860) 350-21281. Storrs ''Shadows and Substance,'' exhibition of shadow puppets from Turkey, Indonesia, China, India and the United States. Through Nov. 17. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Ballard Institute and Museum of Puppetry, 6 Bourne Place. (860) 486-4605. Storrs ''Tradition and Innovation: Latin American Art From the Benton Collection.'' Through June 17. Free. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 4:30 p.m. William Benton Museum of Art, 245 Glenbrook Road. (860) 486-4520. Woodbury ''Art as Impetus,'' works by Kim Bernard and Tom Driscoll. Through June 24. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Fenn Gallery, 345 Main Street South. (203) 263-3449.
